greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) is the number of n-bead necklaces labeled with numbers 1..k not allowing reversal, with no adjacent beads differing by more than 1.
comment: The transposed array (starting with index 0) appears as Table 2 in the Knopfmacher et al. reference. [_Joerg Arndt_, Aug 08 2012]
link: R. H. Hardin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..456
Arnold Knopfmacher, Toufik Mansour, Augustine Munagi, Helmut Prodinger, Smooth words and Chebyshev polynomials, arXiv:0809.0551v1 [math.CO], 2008.
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := 1/n*Sum[DivisorSum[n, EulerPhi[#]*(1+2*Cos[i*Pi/(k+1)])^(n/#)&], {i, 1, k}] // FullSimplify; Table[T[n-k+1, k], {n, 1, 12}, {k, n, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 05 2015, adapted from PARI *)
program: /* from the Knopfmacher et al. reference */
matrix(22,22,n,k, round(T(n,k)) ) /* as matrix shown in comments */
xref: Column 2 is A000031, col. 3 is A208772, col. 4 is A208773, col. 5 is A208774, col. 6 is A208775, col. 7 is A208776.
results.author: _R. H. Hardin_, Mar 01 2012
